required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Evaluate 24-hr Glucose After OD vs BD AZD1656
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomised, Two Way Cross-Over, Single-Blind, Phase I Study to Evaluate 24-hr Glucose Profiles in Patients With T2DM When Dosed OD and BD on Top of Metformin for Four Days With AZD1656

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the 24-hour glucose profiles in diabetic patients treated with metformin following once daily and twice daily oral dosing

primary_outcome.measure: 24-hr glucose (Calculated plasma glucose AUC0-24, change in fasting plasma glucose)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Repeated sampling during the 24 hour period on day -1, 4 and 8

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability (Adverse events (AEs) during the study, blood pressure (BP), pulse rate, safety laboratory variables (incl. glucose) and investigator's interpretation of electrocardiogram (ECG)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Frequent measurements during the study period

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic variables (Area under the plasma conc vs. time curve (AUC0-24), maximum plasma conc (Cmax), time to reach maximum plasma conc(tmax), terminal elimination half-life and apparent oral clearance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Repeated sampling at pre-specified timepoints on day 4 and 8
Repeated sampling during the 24 hour period on day -1, 4 and 8

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- type II diabetes patients, female with non child-bearing potential
- Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM) diagnosis confirmed by C-peptide >0.3nmol/L and no Glutamic acid decarboxylase (GAD) antibodies at enrolment (screening)
- Treatment with metformin as single therapy for T2DM for at least 30 days prior to enrolment and the metformin dose must have been unchanged during this period
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of ischemic heart disease, symptomatic heart failure, stroke, transitory ischemic attack or symptomatic peripheral vascular disease
- Any clinically significant abnormality identified on physical examination, laboratory test or ECG, which in the judgement of investigator would compromise the subject's safety or successful participation in the clinical study

overall_official.affiliation: Healthcare Discoveries LLC Icon Development Solutions

responsible_party.name_title: Klas Malmberg, MD, PhD, Prof. Medical Science Director, Emerging Products
